intro: Sauropus albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower sauropus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it is also valued for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance. The flowers are usually pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in the region.
